.figure--art-directed__variant1 .article__header--art-directed h1 b{font-family:Roboto Condensed,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif;font-display:fallback}@media (min-width:48rem){.figure--art-directed__variant1 .article__header--art-directed h1 b{font-size:3.3em}}.figure--art-directed__variant1 .article__header--art-directed h2{font-family:georgia,serif;font-weight:400;border-top:1px solid #fff;border-bottom:1px solid #fff;font-size:12.8px;font-size:.8rem;text-align:center;padding:.35rem;margin:.25rem 3rem}@media (min-width:48rem){.figure--art-directed__variant1 .article__header--art-directed h2{font-size:1.5rem;padding:1rem;margin:0 0 1rem}}.background-video{position:absolute;width:100%;height:100%;max-width:100%;top:0;left:0;opacity:1}@-webkit-keyframes black-fade{0%{background:#000}to{background:transparent}}@keyframes black-fade{0%{background:#000}to{background:transparent}}@-webkit-keyframes fade-in{0%{opacity:0}to{opacity:1}}@keyframes fade-in{0%{opacity:0}to{opacity:1}}
/*# sourceMappingURL=critical-sciencecore.css.map */
</style>
    <title>Science | AAAS</title>

<link rel="shortcut icon" href="https://www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/favicon.ico" type="image/vnd.microsoft.icon" />

    <link rel="preload" as="style" onload="this.rel='stylesheet'" href="//fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto+Condensed:400,400i,700,700i|Roboto:400,400i,700&amp;subset=cyrillic,cyrillic-ext,greek,greek-ext,latin-ext,vietnamese">
    <link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="/sites/default/files/advagg_css/css__9zevyd0vccxBdypcX9OJeu887I9k_IxZIqGmgb98Hdk__5db1AK6VA9IKDQM72zlEkoVKhTQAHAFP4yWEEcS0yuY__zf1XFYHZdJs89Vosys0zHR_KncKvojwr0kZuqopMObA.css" media="all" />
<link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="/sites/default/files/advagg_css/css__0ndevJxur7TQ7fV_TioyY5AP-vKX7eFSWNOnX5Ce6Kg__UDZhNHUuVq2tXSMaRBUF3xBngbHBdheirB9uW3UclWE__zf1XFYHZdJs89Vosys0zHR_KncKvojwr0kZuqopMObA.css" media="all" />
    <noscript>
      <link rel="preload" href="//fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto+Condensed:400,400i,700,700i|Roboto:400,400i,700&amp;subset=cyrillic,cyrillic-ext,greek,greek-ext,latin-ext,vietnamese">
    </noscript>

    <script id="loadcss">
      /*! loadCSS: load a CSS file asynchronously. [c]2016 @scottjehl, Filament Group, Inc. Licensed MIT */
(function(w){
	"use strict";
	/* exported loadCSS */
	var loadCSS = function( href, before, media ){
		// Arguments explained:
		// `href` [REQUIRED] is the URL for your CSS file.
		// `before` [OPTIONAL] is the element the script should use as a reference for injecting our stylesheet <link> before
			// By default, loadCSS attempts to inject the link after the last stylesheet or script in the DOM. However, you might desire a more specific location in your document.
		// `media` [OPTIONAL] is the media type or query of the stylesheet. By default it will be 'all'
		var doc = w.document;
		var ss = doc.createElement( "link" );
		var ref;
		if( before ){
			ref = before;
		}
		else {
			var refs = ( doc.body || doc.getElementsByTagName( "head" )[ 0 ] ).childNodes;
			ref = refs[ refs.length - 1];
		}

		var sheets = doc.styleSheets;
		ss.rel = "stylesheet";
		ss.href = href;
		// temporarily set media to something inapplicable to ensure it'll fetch without blocking render
		ss.media = "only x";

		// wait until body is defined before injecting link. This ensures a non-blocking load in IE11.
		function ready( cb ){
			if( doc.body ){
				return cb();
			}
			setTimeout(function(){
				ready( cb );
			});
		}
		// Inject link
			// Note: the ternary preserves the existing behavior of "before" argument, but we could choose to change the argument to "after" in a later release and standardize on ref.nextSibling for all refs
			// Note: `insertBefore` is used instead of `appendChild`, for safety re: http://www.paulirish.com/2011/surefire-dom-element-insertion/
		ready( function(){
			ref.parentNode.insertBefore( ss, ( before ? ref : ref.nextSibling ) );
		});
		// A method (exposed on return object for external use) that mimics onload by polling document.styleSheets until it includes the new sheet.
		var onloadcssdefined = function( cb ){
			var resolvedHref = ss.href;
			var i = sheets.length;
			while( i-- ){
				if( sheets[ i ].href === resolvedHref ){
					return cb();
				}
			}
			setTimeout(function() {
				onloadcssdefined( cb );
			});
		};

		function loadCB(){
			if( ss.addEventListener ){
				ss.removeEventListener( "load", loadCB );
			}
			ss.media = media || "all";
		}

		// once loaded, set link's media back to `all` so that the stylesheet applies once it loads
		if( ss.addEventListener ){
			ss.addEventListener( "load", loadCB);
		}
		ss.onloadcssdefined = onloadcssdefined;
		onloadcssdefined( loadCB );
		return ss;
	};
	// commonjs
	if( typeof exports !== "undefined" ){
		exports.loadCSS = loadCSS;
	}
	else {
		w.loadCSS = loadCSS;
	}
}( typeof global !== "undefined" ? global : this ));
      /*! CSS rel=preload polyfill. Depends on loadCSS function. [c]2016 @scottjehl, Filament Group, Inc. Licensed MIT  */
(function( w ){
  // rel=preload support test
  if( !w.loadCSS ){
    return;
  }
  var rp = loadCSS.relpreload = {};
  rp.support = function(){
    try {
      return w.document.createElement( "link" ).relList.supports( "preload" );
    } catch (e) {
      return false;
    }
  };

  // loop preload links and fetch using loadCSS
  rp.poly = function(){
    var links = w.document.getElementsByTagName( "link" );
    for( var i = 0; i < links.length; i++ ){
      var link = links[ i ];
      if( link.rel === "preload" && link.getAttribute( "as" ) === "style" ){
        w.loadCSS( link.href, link );
        link.rel = null;
      }
    }
  };

  // if link[rel=preload] is not supported, we must fetch the CSS manually using loadCSS
  if( !rp.support() ){
    rp.poly();
    var run = w.setInterval( rp.poly, 300 );
    if( w.addEventListener ){
      w.addEventListener( "load", function(){
        w.clearInterval( run );
      } );
    }
    if( w.attachEvent ){
      w.attachEvent( "onload", function(){
        w.clearInterval( run );
      } )
    }
  }
}( this ));
    </script>

  </head>

fill-rule="evenodd"><path d="M123.133 0c19.217 18.153 67.59 163.084 78.628 196.15V0h-78.628m27.194 195.835C139.29 162.11 97.407 18.803 75.137 0H0v195.826h1.627L74.354 4.856 13.58 195.827h1.944L81.821     <div id= "ghLogo" class="gh__logo">
      <a href="//science.sciencemag.org"><svg class="" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 185 51" width="132" height="36" preserveAspectRatio="xMinYMin meet"><title>Science</title><g fill="#fff"><path d="M4.73010157 47.178324L2.62773215 50.4729356.394022053 50.4729356 0 33.9998776 1.57663929 33.9998776C4.33571213 41.5115553 8.40874288 48.6278429 16.5549881 48.6278429 22.3358151     </div>

  <article class="media">

          <div class="media__icon">
                  
  
      <a href="/news/2021/06/nutrition-researchers-urge-update-lab-animal-diets"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="//www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/styles/grid_thumb_-_290x163__16_9_/public/ScienceSource_SS2212057-1280x720.jpg?itok=7teEoQ2U" alt="Laboratory rats in cages" /></a>

    <div class="media__body">

      
            <h2 class="media__headline">
        <a href="/news/2021/06/nutrition-researchers-urge-update-lab-animal-diets">Nutrition researchers urge update to lab animal diets</a>
      </h2>
      <span property="dc:title" content="Nutrition researchers urge update to lab animal diets" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
              <p class="byline">
  By <a href="/author/mennatalla-ibrahim">Mennatalla Ibrahim</a><time>Jun. 17, 2021</time></p>
      
                </div>
  </article>


</li>
          <li>

        <div id="aaas-oas_Right2"></div>
<div class="layout-item home__express" >

          <div class="view-feed-blocks-science-express">

  <h2 class="subsection-title heading--block">First Release <cite>Science</cite> papers</h2>

  
<div class="item-list">    <ul class="headline-list">          <li class="row-1 odd first last"><article class="media media--priority-2">
  <div class="media__body">
      <h2 class="media__headline"><span class="field-content"><a href="http://science.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/short/science.abg7917v1?rss=1">Plant &quot;helper&quot; immune receptors are Ca2+-permeable nonselective cation channels</a></span></h2>
  </div>
</article></li>
      </ul></div>
  <p class="meta-line meta-line--more"><a href="http://science.sciencemag.org/content/early/recent">Complete List</a></p>

        <div class="container">
                      <div class="primary" id="content_2">
                            
  
  
    <h2 class="subsection-title heading--block">Featured Videos<a href="/videos" target="_blank">Watch more Videos</a></h2>
  
  <div class="video-player">
    <div class="video-player__lead">
        <div class="view-article-lists-featured-video-one">


    <div>
      
  <div>        <h2 class="media__headline"><a href="/news/2021/06/killer-whales-form-killer-friendships-new-drone-footage-suggests"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/GettyImages-823340688-1280x720.jpg" width="1280" height="720" alt="Pod of transient orca whales" /></a></h2>  </div>  
  <div>        <h2 class="media__headline"><a href="/news/2021/06/killer-whales-form-killer-friendships-new-drone-footage-suggests">Killer whales form killer friendships, new drone footage suggests</a></h2>  </div>  </div>


  </div>
    </div>
    <div class ="video-player__playlist">
        <div class="view-article-lists-featured-video-four">


  
    <ul class="item-list">          <li>

  <article class="media media--var media--priority-2">

          <div class="media__icon">
                  
  
      <a href="/news/2021/06/cicadas-come-out-every-17-years-may-emerge-more-often-future"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="//www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/styles/grid_thumb_-_290x163__16_9_/public/061521-thumbnail-playbutton.png?itok=Y6affDvv" alt="cicado in the ground with play arrow overlay" /></a>  
              </div>

  <article class="media headline-list__outer-lead" about="/careers/2021/05/choose-career-i-needed-do-more-follow-my-dream" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document"><div class="media__icon">

      </h2>
      <span property="dc:title" content="Nonreplicable publications are cited more than replicable ones" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
              <p class="byline">
  By <a href="/journal-author/marta-serra-garcia">Marta Serra-Garcia</a>, <a href="/journal-author/uri-gneezy">Uri Gneezy</a><time>May. 19, 2021</time></p>
      
                </div>
  </article>
</li>
      </ul></div><div class="category-item">


    
    
  
  <article class="media headline-list__outer-lead" about="/research-article/sex-chromosome-transformation-and-origin-male-specific-x-chromosome-creeping-vole" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document"><div class="media__icon">
              
  
      <img typeof="foaf:Image" src="//www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/styles/article_main_medium/public/images/rt_scitoc_may7_R1.jpg?itok=AsbtvGlz&amp;c=729c1c4360227d7cfd1ce4ad06c52457" alt="A young creeping vole.">
</div>
    <div class="media__body">
                  <h2 class="media__headline"><a href="http://science.sciencemag.org/content/372/6542/592">Making a male</a></h2>
      <span property="dc:title" content="Sex chromosome transformation and the origin of a male-specific X chromosome in the creeping vole" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>              <p class="byline">
  By <a href="/journal-author/matthew-b-couger">Matthew B. Couger</a>, <a href="/journal-author/scott-w-roy">Scott W. Roy</a>, <span class="et-al">et al.</span><time>May. 7, 2021</time></p>
          </div>
  </article>


  
    <ul class="item-list">
<li>

  <article class="media media--priority-2"><div class="media__body">

      
            <h2 class="media__headline">
        <a href="http://immunology.sciencemag.org/content/6/59/eabj1750">SARS-CoV-2 variants of concern partially escape humoral but not T-cell responses in COVID-19 convalescent donors and vaccinees</a>
      </h2>
      <span property="dc:title" content="SARS-CoV-2 variants of concern partially escape humoral but not T-cell responses in COVID-19 convalescent donors and vaccinees" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
              <p class="byline">
  By <a href="/journal-author/katharina-s-schmitz">Katharina S. Schmitz</a>, <a href="/journal-author/tom-g-caniels">Tom G. Caniels</a>, <span class="et-al">et al.</span><time>May. 7, 2021</time></p>
      
                </div>
  </article>
</li>
          <li>

  <article class="media media--priority-2"><div class="media__body">

      
            <h2 class="media__headline">
        <a href="/news/2021/05/human-tissue-preserved-world-war-i-yields-new-clues-about-1918-pandemic">Human tissue preserved since World War I yields new clues about 1918 pandemic</a>
      </h2>
      <span property="dc:title" content="Human tissue preserved since World War I yields new clues about 1918 pandemic" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
              <p class="byline">
  By <a href="/author/kai-kupferschmidt">Kai Kupferschmidt</a><time>May. 17, 2021</time></p>
      
                </div>
  </article>
</li>
      </ul></div>

    


              </div>            </div>
          
          
            <div class="secondary" id="content_side_5">
              
  
  <div class="layout-item" >

        <h2 class="title subsection-title">Latest News</h2>
      <div class="force_trending" id="force_trending"></div><div class="force_trending" id="force_most_read"></div>
</div>
    


            </div>
                  </div>
      </div>
                <div class="row">
        <div class="container">
                      <div class="primary" id="content_6">
                            
  
  
          <div class="view-article-lists-block-11">

  <h2 class="subsection-title "><cite>Science</cite> Podcast <a href="/podcasts">View all episodes</a></h2>

    <div>
    <article class="media media--featured">
      <div class="media__icon">
      
  
      <a href="/podcast/keeping-ads-out-dreams-and-calculating-cost-climate-displacement"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="//www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/styles/article_main_teaser/public/images/amphan-pod-overlay_0.jpg?itok=sPVtJf4X" alt="Land that has been destroyed by a cyclone with podcast symbol overlay" /></a>  
    </div>
  
  <div class="media__body">
          <h3 class="overline">
  
      <span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2021-06-17T14:00:00-04:00">Jun. 17, 2021</span>  
</h3>
    
              <div class="file-audio audio--podcast align-right">
        <span class="audio__title">Science Podcast</span>
        
  
      <div class="mediaelement-audio"><audio  src="https://traffic.omny.fm/d/clips/aaea4e69-af51-495e-afc9-a9760146922b/95ab13e7-f709-4a58-acad-aaea01775538/22cb562f-2641-44c9-8744-ad4a00d85f91/audio.mp3" class="mediaelement-formatter-identifier-1624242054-0" preload="none" controls="controls" ></audio></div>  
      </div>
    


        <h2 class="media__headline"><a href="/podcast/keeping-ads-out-dreams-and-calculating-cost-climate-displacement">
  
      Podcast: Keeping ads out of dreams, and calculating the cost of climate displacement  
</a></h2>
    <span property="dc:title" content="Keeping ads out of dreams, and calculating the cost of climate displacement" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
          <div class="media__deck">
  
      On this weeks show: Could advertisers invade our dreams, and the struggle to understand the costs of climate-driven relocation  
</div>
    
    <ul class="podcast-options">
            <li><a href="https://traffic.omny.fm/d/clips/aaea4e69-af51-495e-afc9-a9760146922b/95ab13e7-f709-4a58-acad-aaea01775538/22cb562f-2641-44c9-8744-ad4a00d85f91/audio.mp3">Download MP3</a></li>
            <li><a href="/podcasts">Past Episodes</a></li>
      <li><a href="/rss/podcast.xml">Science Podcast RSS Feed</a></li>
      <li><a href="http://phobos.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewPodcast?id=120329020" target="_blank">Subscribe Through iTunes</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</article>
  </div>


  </div>

            <div class="secondary" id="content_side_6">
              
  
  
        <p><a href="//www.sciencemag.org/custom-publishing/webinars"><img alt="Webinar Promo" src="//www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/Unknown.jpeg?itok=vyZlX3Jn" /></a></p>

      </div>
                <div class="row">
        <div class="container">
                      <div class="primary" id="content_7">
                            
  
  
        <h2 class="subsection-title heading--block">How To Get Published</h2>

<p>The strength of <cite>Science</cite> and its online journal sites rests with the strengths of its community of authors, who provide cutting-edge research, incisive scientific commentary, and insights on whats important to the scientific world. To learn more about how to get published in any of our journals, <a href="//www.sciencemag.org/authors/contributing-science-family-journals">visit our guide for contributors</a>, or visit the how-to page for each individual journal.</p>

<p><a href="//www.sciencemag.org/authors/information-authors"><cite>Science</cite></a> | <a href="//advances.sciencemag.org/content/information-authors"><cite>Science Advances</cite></a> | <a href="//www.sciencemag.org/journals/immunology/information-for-authors"><cite>Science Immunology</cite></a> | <a href="//www.sciencemag.org/journals/robotics/information-for-authors"><cite>Science Robotics</cite></a> | <a href="//stke.sciencemag.org/about/ifora"><cite>Science Signaling</cite></a> | <a href="//stm.sciencemag.org/content/information-authors"><cite>Science Translational Medicine</cite></a></p>

<a  style="width: auto; display: inline-block;" class="btn--cta btn--cta--large align-right" href="//cts.sciencemag.org/scc/login.html;jsessionid=A99A8B34CD07506DDEF791E0C91183B4">Get Started</a>


    


                          </div>
          
          
            <div class="secondary" id="content_side_7">
              
  
  
        <!-- <img src="http://styleguide.sciencemag.org/images/intrivoten.png"> -->

        <div id="aaas-oas_x51"></div>
    


            </div>
                  </div>
      </div>
          
  </div>

  <div class="promo-foot--current" >

          <div class="view-footer-promo-block-issue-footer">

  Vol 372,

      Issue 6548  </p>


<a href="https://science.sciencemag.org/">

AAAS is a partner of <a href="//www.who.int/hinari/en/" target="_blank">HINARI</a>, <a href="http://www.fao.org/agora/en/" target="_blank">AGORA</a>, <a href="http://www.unep.org/oare/" target="_blank">OARE</a>,&nbsp;<a href="//www.chorusaccess.org/" target="_blank">CHORUS</a>, <a href="//www.clockss.org/" target="_blank">CLOCKSS</a>, <a href="//www.crossref.org/" target="_blank">CrossRef</a> and <a href="//www.projectcounter.org/" target="_blank">COUNTER</a>.</p>

<script type="text/javascript">

    function adDemo(param) {

      let urlParams = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);

      const oasLoaded = oas_tag;

      if (oasLoaded && urlParams.get(param)) {

        let campaign_page =  'sciencemag.org' + '/' + urlParams.get(param);

        function reload() {
          console.log(oas_tag.site_page, campaign_page);

          oas_tag.site_page = campaign_page;

          console.log('trying...');

          if (oas_tag.site_page === campaign_page) {
            oas_tag.reloadAds();
            clearInterval(adTimer);
            console.log('done.');
          }
        }

        let adTimer = setInterval(reload, 500);
      }
      else {
        // console.log("Nope!");
      }
    }
    adDemo('campaign');
  </script>
      
              
        <ul class="footlinks"><li><a href="//www.sciencemag.org/about/terms-service" title="">Terms of Service</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.sciencemag.org/about/privacy-policy" title="">Privacy Policy</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.aaas.org/contact-aaas" target="_blank">Contact AAAS</a></li>
</ul>

//--><!]]>
</script>
    <script type="text/javascript">
      var fontTimeOut = 2000;

      var fontRoboto = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto");

      var fontRobotoBold = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto", {
        "weight": "bold"
      });

      var fontRobotoItalic = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto", {
        "font-style": "italic"
      });

      var fontRobotoBoldItalic = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto", {
        "font-weight": "bold",
        "font-style": "italic"
      });

      var fontRobotoCond = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto");

      var fontRobotoCondBold = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto Condensed", {
        "weight": "bold"
      });

      var fontRobotoCondItalic = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto Condensed", {
        "font-weight": "italic"
      });

      var fontRobotoCondBoldItalic = new FontFaceObserver("Roboto Condensed", {
        "font-weight": "bold",
        "font-style": "italic"
      });

      Promise.all ([
        fontRoboto.load(null, fontTimeOut),
        fontRobotoBold.load(null, fontTimeOut),
        fontRobotoItalic.load(null, fontTimeOut),
        fontRobotoBoldItalic.load(null, fontTimeOut),
        fontRobotoCond.load(null, fontTimeOut),
        fontRobotoCondBold.load(null, fontTimeOut),
        fontRobotoCondItalic.load(null, fontTimeOut),
        fontRobotoCondBoldItalic.load(null, fontTimeOut)
      ]).then ( function () {
        document.documentElement.className += " fonts-loaded";
      });
    </script>

_satellite.pageBottom();
